result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michelle R Herrmann was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 represents DNA surcharge.  $35 represents Blood Draw Test fee.
With credit for any administrative suspension.

Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to operating a motor vehicle.  The length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued.  (Call Dept of Motor Vehicles with questions).    Court finds defendant eligible for reduced cost on Ignition Interlock Device due to hardship.
